result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel L Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Probation agent to request a probation review hearing about 4 months after defendant is done serving his jail sentence. Conditions of probation apply to both counts.
Concurrent with: 15-CF-24, 15-CF-68 & 15-CF-117.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

records.addlTxt: DC Jail Request for Sentence Modification - defendant wants to know if he could return to child care to finish out his sentence. Court denies request.

DC Jail petition for sentence modification - Court revokes 30 days of huber/work release privileges.

DC Jail request for sentence modification - defendant requests furlough to visit his mother in the hospital. Court responds: if jail administration is ok with it, 8 hour furlough fine by me. Not days. DTE

Door County Jail request for sentence modification - defendant requests 45 day furlough to assist girlfriend with the birth of their child. Court not granting a 45 day furlough, 24 hour furlough for birth and that's it. NO alcohol when out. DTE
from Anakaren Garcia requesting furlough for defendant for the birth of their child. Court responds, defendant needs to make request on jail form. DTE

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense advises of correction to PSI, gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
for DNA Sample

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Atty Meier asks court to revoke bond in all files. State doesn't feel that is necessary as defendant is being held awaiting sentencing after revocation in 14-CF-72.  Court leaves bonds as previously set in all files.
Defense waives reading of Information.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Defense Discovery Demand

Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Defendant Gabriel L Perez in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Discussion regarding representation in new file. Defendant feels he may now qualify for PD. Court won't appoint an atty if defendant qualifies for PD representation. Atty Meier indicates he doesn't take PD appointments, advises he is not currently representing defendant in 15-CF-147 but would like to resolve all matters together along with revocation case.  Atty Meier would like to see discovery on new file, has a few questions of the State before proceeding. Court appoints Atty Meier in 15-CF-147 only, sets plea hearing for 12/30/15. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Court questions whether defendant qualifies for PD? Will address at 12/14/15 hearing. DTE
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gabriel L Perez in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Atty Meier indicates he is not representing defendant in this file. Defendant requests time to look into what he wants to do regarding legal representation. Atty Meier indicates if defendant doesn't qualify for PD representation, he will accept court appointment. Atty Meier requests a status in December. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 3/17/16)
No contact direct or indirect with Q-Mart south store on Green Bay Road.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Gabriel L Perez appears by video conference.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/06/15 at 8:30 am.
